website_summaries.verdict: The Asics Roadhawk FF has certainly earned a good number of followers owing to its affordable price and agreeable build. They also lauded the lightweight nature of this road shoe, as well as its comfortable cushioning and other efficient features. However, there were those who felt very restricted because of its apparently narrow forefoot section.
pros: The customers were very happy with the excellent cushioning of the Asics Roadhawk FF
The runners highlighted how the snug fit of the upper prevented sliding inside the shoe
According to the wearers, the shoe’s light weight increased their efficiency during running
The purchasers found the price of the Roadhawk FF very reasonable
A runner considered using this shoe for an upcoming marathon owing to its great all-round features
cons: Some users were dissatisfied with the narrow toe-box of the Asics Roadhawk FF

customer_reviews.title: Apparently running is good for you
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old geezer and just starting out with running so can't give any expert insight, but I can say they are super comfortable, light as a feather and nicely cushioned. I spent a long time um-ing and ah-ing because so many people seem to struggle with sizing but i needn't have worried... on me at least, the fit was exactly right (I'm a uk size nine normally and by their size guide too). Now if only my joints worked as well as the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: wishbone06

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trainers and exactly what I was looking for. Was suffering from sore feet due to upping my milage and my old running shoes weren't cutting it. After loads of research I opted for these and after running in these for a few weeks now I am extremely happy with them. No more foot pain at all. Very comfortable, light and they look good. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Conall Mc Ginty

customer_reviews.title: Ok but a bit boring
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price. Could do with a bit more heel cushioning. I probably would not buy again. I should have got something more reflective or brighter. It seems well made and so far after 40miles the shoes are holding up.
customer_reviews.author: U. Ali

customer_reviews.title: Road race ready
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and endurable. Bought for a half-marathon in a few months time. Fantastic price when purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight shoes exactly as i like my running shoes
customer_reviews.text: They really worth the money. Very lightweight shoes exactly as i like my running shoes. They can be used everywhere for running. Totally recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They feel really good when running in them
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe these shoes are so cheap. They feel really good when running in them.
customer_reviews.author: Juls

customer_reviews.title: but they are very comfortable, with good cushion and breathability
customer_reviews.text: I take UK 11 and in that size they are a snug fit but not too small. Can't talk about longevity yet, but they are very comfortable, with good cushion and breathability. They actually make my feet look smaller which is a rare thing.
customer_reviews.author: SteveM

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for smooth surfaces or treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for smooth surfaces or treadmill. Not suitable for rougher trails though, centre section of sole is too soft for that.
customer_reviews.author: mtbexpress

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really a good running shoe, found it very responsive during run.
customer_reviews.author: Habibullah Chowdhury

customer_reviews.title: best choice for street running
customer_reviews.text: had to order half size larger, once arrived best shoes for street running, extra light, brilliant for long runs - love them to pieces
customer_reviews.author: Jakub

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality again from Asics. These have raised arches which my son finds really comfortable
customer_reviews.author: J W.

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of trainers
customer_reviews.text: Good fit so my Son in Law says, good company to buy from, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Nanny 64

customer_reviews.title: asics running shoe
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, perfect fit, delivery very fast would recommend friends and family
customer_reviews.author: stephen hall

customer_reviews.title: These hurt. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an adidas pair after a half-marathon. I had read alot of reviews first which gave an overall positive view. Initial impressions: they looked good and seem to fit. However, running in them proved a different matter. They began to hurt as they do not provide enough cushioning on the soles. Very disappointed and I will be replacing them with more suitable running shoes. For this reason I cannot recommend them for anyone who wants to actually run.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L

customer_reviews.title: Trainers
customer_reviews.text: Trainers are okay but I would not recommend them for running .
customer_reviews.author: Keith E Kinsella

product_meta.title: ASICS Men's Roadhawk Ff Running Shoes
product_meta.description: The RoadHawk FF for Men's is extremely light and breathable, the perfect all-rounder for every day. The breathable mesh upper keeps your feet cool. The very lightweight FlyteFoam midsole also guarantees a high degree of damping without unnecessary weight. Thanks to the full contact outer sole and the 8mm blasting, you enjoy a direct ground feel when walking. This shoe is tailor-made for runners with a neutral foot position and guarantees a long-lasting pleasure.
feature_bullets: Seamless construction - Reduces the risk of chafing.
Overlays - Wrap the foot for extra support.
Discrete eyelets - Disperse lace tension and create a customised fit.
ComforDry Sockliner - For extra underfoot comfort and moisture-management.
